H0.text: Minerals are the locally available resources most likely to be depleted in desert communities as human populations increase and deplete local resources more than in other communities.

H1.text: Oxygen is the locally available resource most likely to be depleted in desert communities compared to other communities as human populations increase.

H2.text: Gasoline is the locally available resource most likely to be depleted in desert communities when human populations increase.

H3.text: Water is the locally available resource most likely to be depleted in desert communities when increased human populations lead to depletion of locally available resources within communities, compared to other communities.

A4.text: Regions with a desert climate often face physical water scarcity.

A5.text: Water scarcity is caused by a mismatch between when and where people need water, and when and where it is available.
